title: The CDC’s most recent updates on COVID-19 vaccinations
snippet: The most recent recommendations from the CDC on COVID-19 vaccines call for “vaccination based on shared clinical decision-making.”

subnews.title: CDC signs off on RFK Jr. vaccine recommendations
subnews.snippet: The new schedule drops a broad recommendation that Americans age 65 and older get a COVID-19. vaccine.

subnews.title: CDC signs off on fall Covid shots. It may not be easy to get one, depending on where you live.
subnews.snippet: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention updated its Covid vaccine guidance Monday to recommend Covid shots for people 65 and older and only after...

title: Worried about splitting up the MMR vaccine into three separate shots? You should be, this doctor says
snippet: While President Donald Trump is pushing to split the MMR vaccine into three shots, experts say there's no scientific reason for it, and it could lead to...

subnews.title: Acting CDC director calls to 'break up' the measles, mumps and rubella vaccine into three shots
subnews.snippet: Acting CDC Director Jim O'Neill called on vaccine manufacturers to develop separate shots for measles, mumps and rubella instead of the current combination...

subnews.title: Experts Pan Call to Break Up the Measles, Mumps, and Rubella Vaccine
subnews.snippet: The temporary CDC head's call to split apart the measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine into three separate shots drew swift rebukes from pediatric and...

title: State reports season's first flu death out of western North Carolina
snippet: The North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (NCDHHS) has reported the state's first flu-related death of the season.

subnews.title: NCDHHS reports first flu-related death of 2025-2026 season in western NC
subnews.snippet: On Oct. 8, the North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services announced the first flu-related death of the 2025-2026 flu season, an adult in WNC.

subnews.title: North Carolina reports first flu death of the season
subnews.snippet: Health officials in North Carolina have confirmed the first flu-related death of the season, urging residents to get vaccinated and take precautions.

title: Fatty liver disease risk linked to both sugary and diet drinks
snippet: Researchers released a study suggesting both sugary drinks and diet sodas are associated with a higher risk of consumers developing fatty liver disease.

subnews.title: Sorry soda lovers, less than 1 can a day could cause this health problem, new study says
subnews.snippet: As little as 9 oz of a sugary drink per day, like soda or diet coke, can increase your risk of this health condition. A standard can is 12 oz.

subnews.title: Diet and sugary drinks raise risk of common liver disease by up to 60%, new research finds
subnews.snippet: Drinking diet and sugary beverages may raise the risk of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease by up to 60%, according to new research.

title: Babies take a lesson from soldiers in the war against malaria
snippet: Inspired by a military strategy to ward off disease-carrying mosquitoes, researchers see if the technique will help cut malaria infections in little ones.

title: Lesser-Known Breast Cancer Surging in US, Report Warns
snippet: A lesser-known type of breast cancer is on the rise among women in the U.S.—highlighting the need for us to pay closer attention to it.

subnews.title: Researchers warn of rare, dangerous type of breast cancer on the rise
subnews.snippet: Lobular breast cancer rates are rising three times as fast as all other breast cancers combined, 2.8% per year versus .8% per year, researchers reported.

subnews.title: Lobular Breast Cancer Statistics 2025 – American Cancer Society Journals
subnews.snippet: American Cancer Society Journals shared a post on LinkedIn about a recent article by Angela N. Giaquinto et al., adding:.

title: Low-income families are still waiting on Covid-19 vaccines for kids, but states say they’re coming
snippet: Many low-income families who normally get no-cost Covid-19 vaccines for their kids through the Vaccines for Children program have been told those shots...

title: New gene linked to Alzheimer's disease is discovered... putting more Americans at high risk of the condition
snippet: Researchers have identified a gene that they reported was linked to a 1.5 times-higher likelihood of suffering from Alzheimer's disease. Advertisement.

title: Locally transmitted US malaria cases highlight increased risk, CDC report suggests
snippet: A new paper describes the first locally acquired cases of mosquito-transmitted malaria in the United States in 20 years. The paper, published yesterday in...

title: Women carry a higher genetic risk of depression, new study says
snippet: Researchers in Australia find 16 genetic variants linked to depression in women but only eight in men.
